Package org.dkr.graph.algo.path

Class MinimumSpanningTree<VV>

java.lang.Object
org.dkr.graph.algo.path.MinimumSpanningTree<VV>
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.apache.flink.graph.GraphAlgorithm<Long,​VV,​Double,​org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<org.apache.flink.graph.Edge<Long,​Double>>>
public class MinimumSpanningTree<VV> extends Object implements org.apache.flink.graph.GraphAlgorithm<Long,​VV,​Double,​org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<org.apache.flink.graph.Edge<Long,​Double>>>
This algorithm find a minimum spanning tree of a graph with a naive method.

    • setMaxIterations

      public void setMaxIterations​(int maxIterations)

    • run

      public org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<org.apache.flink.graph.Edge<Long,​Double>> run​(org.apache.flink.graph.Graph<Long,​VV,​Double> oriGraph) throws Exception
      1. Each vertex finds a shortest edge that connects to other groups and save it.

      2. If the selected edge is same as the received edge(i.e., a pair of vertices selected each other), retain this edge.

      3. There may exist more than one edges from a group. So broadcast the edge to the group and retain the minimum edge. Note if all edges retained, MSTUpdater will have no change and stop. So execute an extra blank operation to keep activity.

      4. Add the selected edge to MST.

      5. Grouping. Broadcast the selected edge and let all vertices know which group it will be merged in.

      6. Broadcast the merging information and update the group in each vertex.

      7. Change the belonging group ID.

      Repeat. The function will end if there is no change(no edge selected in step 1).

      Specified by:
      run in interface org.apache.flink.graph.GraphAlgorithm<Long,​VV,​Double,​org.apache.flink.api.java.DataSet<org.apache.flink.graph.Edge<Long,​Double>>>
      Throws:
      Exception
